sentences.en: ‘What do you want?’ Mike snapped.
sentences.cn: “你想干什么？”迈克厉声说道。

sentences.en: A snap election would be to their disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 提前选举将对他们不利。

sentences.en: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.cn: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.en: all the tickets have been snapped up.
sentences.cn: 所有的票已被抢购一空。

sentences.en: come on, Fran—snap out of it!.
sentences.cn: 来吧，弗兰——振作起来！。

sentences.en: Every minute or so I could hear a snap, a crack and a crash as another tree went down.
sentences.cn: 几乎每隔一分钟，我就会听见又有一棵树倒下时发出的折断声、噼啪声和塌倒声。

sentences.en: gourmet-quality meals are ready in a snap.
sentences.cn: 美味佳肴立刻就准备好了。

sentences.en: gourmet-quality meals are ready in a snap.
sentences.cn: 美味佳肴立刻就准备好了。

sentences.en: gourmet-quality meals are ready in a snap.
sentences.cn: 美味佳肴立刻就准备好了。

sentences.en: He broke off the twig with a snap.
sentences.cn: 他啪地一声把那根树枝折断了.

sentences.en: He did not care a snap to talk loudly in class.
sentences.cn: 他毫不在乎地在课堂上大声讲话.

sentences.en: He shifted his weight and a twig snapped.
sentences.cn: 他挪了挪身子，一根树枝随即喀嚓一声折断了。

sentences.en: He shut the book with a snap and stood up.
sentences.cn: 他啪的一声合上书，站起身来。

sentences.en: His arms look like they might snap under the weight of his gloves.
sentences.cn: 他的胳膊看起来好像不堪手套重负要折断了一样。

sentences.en: His teeth clicked as he snapped at my ankle.
sentences.cn: 他作势猛咬我的脚踝时，牙齿咔嚓作响。

sentences.en: I could obtain with the snap of my fingers anything I chose.
sentences.cn: 我不费吹灰之力就可以得到我看中的任何东西。

sentences.en: I think this is too important for a snap decision.
sentences.cn: 我认为，这件事非常重要，不能仓促作决定。

sentences.en: I'm sorry, Casey, I didn't mean to snap at you like that.
sentences.cn: 对不起，凯西，我不是有意要跟你凶的。

sentences.en: It'simportant not to make snap judgments.
sentences.cn: 不要急于作出判断——这一点很重要。

sentences.en: Often a patient cannot snap out of their negativity that easily.
sentences.cn: 病人常常不能那么容易就打消掉消极的情绪。

sentences.en: She heard a twig snap.
sentences.cn: 她听到一根小树枝啪地折断了.

sentences.en: snapped up the introductory offer.
sentences.cn: 迅速得到初步的供应

sentences.en: The brake pedal had just snapped off.
sentences.cn: 制动踏板刚才突然断裂了。

sentences.en: The dog started snapping at my heels.
sentences.cn: 这条狗开始咬我的鞋跟。

sentences.en: The string broke with a snap.
sentences.cn: 吧的一声,弦断了.

sentences.en: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.cn: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

sentences.en: Then something seemed to snap in me. I couldn't endure any more.
sentences.cn: 这时候，我的心里像有个东西突然绷断了——我再也忍受不了啦。

sentences.en: These earrings snap on with special fastener.
sentences.cn: 这付耳环是用特制的按扣扣上去的.

sentences.en: These earrings snap on with special fasteners.
sentences.cn: 这副耳环是用特制的按扣扣上去的.

words.tran_cn: 厉声说话的；生气勃勃的；时髦的；爽快的
鲷鱼；揿钮；咬人的狗；暴燥的人
咬；厉声说；咯嗒一声关上

phrases.tran_cn: 提前选举；临时选举；仓促的选举
(非正式)迅速努力从（坏情绪）中恢复过来

phrases.phrase: snap out of it【非正式用语】
phrases.tran_cn: 恢复：迅速从失望、痛快和自我怜悯等不健康状态恢复到平时的状况
卡环；止动环；扣环；弹簧锁环

trans.tran_cn: 容易的，喀嗒一声扣下的，仓促的
trans.tran_en: a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion

trans.tran_cn: （在“对儿”牌游戏中出现同样的牌时喊的）对儿,（对于两件相同事物表示惊讶）真巧
（树枝等的）突然折断，严厉的话，突然的撕咬，尤指关上或断裂的声音)啪嗒声
trans.tran_en: a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

trans.tran_cn: 咔嚓折断，啪地绷断；吧嗒一声；猛咬；厉声说话，怒声责骂
trans.tran_en: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this

trans.tran_cn: 啪啪作响，（目光）闪耀，（牙齿等）咯咯作响，（精神）突然崩溃
trans.tran_en: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this

trans.tran_cn: 拍照，用子母扣扣，[棒球]快速传（球），拍…的快照
